routine

Class Routine

  • java.lang.Object
    • routine.Routine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccelerateRoutine, ConstantSpeedRoutine

    public class Routine
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A routine is a Runnable that given a List of instructions and an AbstractEsc executes the instructions sequentially. A routine can be stopped before its completion, stopping a routine in this way has the effect of leaving the Esc running the last instruction that was sent, unless stopped otherwise. Also a Static premade routines are provided as example and for a fast test of other components, therefore should not be used otherwise.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Routine

        public Routine(java.lang.String name,
               java.util.List<TelemetryParameter> params,
               java.util.List<Instruction> instructions)
        Constructs a routine without attaching an Esc to it. Associates a name, the List of Instruction and the List of TelemetryParameter to use.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the routine
        params - a List of TelemetryParameter, pass an empty list if none are required
        instructions - a List of Instruction

    • Method Detail

      • getOutput

        public java.io.PipedOutputStream getOutput()
        Returns:
        the PipedOutputStream where the Esc writes its telemetry filtered by the TelemetryParameter specified when creating the routine

      • getParameters

        public java.util.List<TelemetryParameter> getParameters()
        Returns:
        the List of TelemetryParameter that can be read through the PipedOutputStream given by getOutput()

      • run
